SUBSECTION.HEAD: WHAT IS Perlanet?
SUBSECTION.TEXT: Perlanet is a Perl module for aggregating web feeds.
It allows you to aggregate a number of web feeds (both Atom and RSS) and to publish a web page and another web feed containing the aggregated content.

SUBSECTION.HEAD: HOW DO I INSTALL IT?
SUBSECTION.TEXT: Perlanet uses the standard Perl module architecture and can therefore by installed using the standard Perl method which, in brief, goes something like this:
SUBSECTION.CODE: gzip -cd Perlanet-X.XX.tar.gz | tar xvf - cd Perlanet-X.XX perl Build.PL ./Build ./Build test ./Build install
SUBSECTION.TEXT: Where X.XX is the version number of the module which you are installing.
You can also install it using either the 'cpan' or 'cpanp' command line programs.
